business.headline: NPS Vatsalya: 9,705 minors sign up on Day 1. Here's how to invest for your child?The scheme, overseen by the Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA), is part of the National Pension System (NPS) and aims to help parents and guardians begin retirement savings for their children from an early age

Study shows people in US work 5 days to buy iPhone 16; how long do Indians need?A recent study reveals how long people in different countries need to work in order to afford the iPhone 16, with citizens in Switzerland requiring the least number of days.
No work, no pay: Samsung warns workers on strike in Chennai The strike, which began on September 9, 2024, involves hundreds of workers at Samsung's home appliances factory near Chennai.

Sensex ends 1,400 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; ICICI Bank jumps 5%At the closing bell, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,381.99 points to 84,566.79, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 375.15 points to settle at 25,790.95.
Ashneer Grover shares why he quit EY in a day despite Rs 1 crore salaryIn an old video, Grover shares why he left Ernst & Young (EY) on his very first day despite being offered a Rs 1 crore salary.

Should you buy Vodafone Idea shares after 20% fall? UBS shares new target priceVodafone Idea shares fell 20% after the Supreme Court on Thursday dismissed the company's curative petition, which sought a re-computation of Adjusted Gross Revenue (AGR) dues.
Explained: Why IIFL Finance shares surged 13% todayIIFL Finance stock climbed to a high of Rs 560.60, marking its peak since late February, before settling to trade 9.31% higher as of 2:06 pm.
Explained: Why Cochin Shipyard shares soared 10% todayAt around 12:25 pm, shares of the company were up 9.45% at Rs 1,837.30 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

Western Carriers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusWestern Carriers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status online via the BSE website or through Link Intime India Private Ltd.

Sensex jumps over 1,276 points to cross 84,400, Nifty nears 25,800The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1275.45 points to 84,460.25 at 12:49 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 368.70 points to trade at 25,784.50.

RITES shares rise 8% but why railway PSU stock may be showing 48% slideDespite this positive momentum, many investors were caught off guard, seeing what appeared to be a 48% slide in the stock price on their trading apps.
Elliott Hill's 32-year journey at Nike from intern to CEO goes viralElliott Hill, who has spent over 32 years at Nike, started his journey as an intern and will now be leading the iconic company.
Sensex surges 500 points, Nifty gains momentum; JSW Steel jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 415.45 points at 83,600.25 at 10:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 135.80 points to trade at 25,550.90.

Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Check status, GMP, subscription Arkade Developers IPO allotment: Investors can check their allotment status by logging into the BSE website or the Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd website, the issue's registrar.
Northern Arc Capital IPO allotment tomorrow: Check latest subscription, GMPNorthern Arc Capital Limited, founded in 2009, provides retail loans to underserved households and businesses across India.

Sensex, Nifty end higher after US Fed's 50 bps rate cut; NTPC gainsThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 236.57 points higher at 83,184.80, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 38.25 points higher at 25,415.80. Both the indices had hit fresh all-time highs in early trade.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Court strikes down IT Rules changes allowing Centre to set up Fact Check UnitsThe 'tie-breaker' judge of the Bombay High Court held that the amendments to the IT Rules violate rights under Article 14 and Article 19 of the Constitution of India.

Tirupati laddoos row: Jagan Reddy says no violation by him, Centre seeks reportAt the Tirumala Venkateswara Temple in Andhra Pradesh, which sees an average daily footfall of over 60,000, laddoo is offered as prasadam. A recent lab report revealed the presence of animal fat in it, leading to a massive controversy.

Kicked on chest, flashed: Army officer's fiancée on Odisha police station ordealThe Army officer and his fiancée had approached Bharatpur police station to file a complaint about road rage. However, what followed was a harrowing experience for the couple.

Ukraine, Gaza and cancer fight on agenda at Joe Biden's farewell Quad SummitPrime Minister Narendra Modi will attend the Quad leaders summit, hosted by US President Joe Biden on September 21 in Delaware, alongside leaders from Australia and Japan. The summit aims to strengthen alliances in the Indo-Pacific region, focusing on countering China's influence, maritime security, and emerging technologies.
Ashneer Grover shares why he quit EY in a day despite Rs 1 crore salaryIn an old video, Grover shares why he left Ernst & Young (EY) on his very first day despite being offered a Rs 1 crore salary.

Hezbollah fires 140 rockets at Northern Israel in retaliation for bombing: ReportA day after Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah vowed to retaliate against Israel for a mass bombing attack, the militant group fired 140 rockets at northern Israel on Friday.

Gurugram biker death: Accused was previously fined for wrong side drivingGurugram SUV-bike crash: Akshat Garg died last week after his bike was hit by an SUV that was being driven recklessly in the wrong direction on Golf Course Road in DLF Phase II.

Politics in name of God: Jagan Reddy refutes charges amid Tirupati laddoos rowFormer Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Jagan Mohan Reddy has dismissed the ruling Telugu Desam Party's charges of the presence of lard, beef tallow and fish oil in the ghee used for the preparation of the laddoos at Tirupati temple.

Jasprit Bumrah's Chennai Test special wrecks Bangladesh on 17-wicket Day 2India vs Bangladesh, 1st Test: Jasprit Bumrah came up with another memorable show at home as India bowled Bangladesh out for 149. On a day which saw 17 wickets fall, India seized control, stretching their lead to 308 runs on Friday.

Firing at Congress candidate's convoy in Haryana's Panchkula, aide shot atA firing incident was reported at Congress MLA Pradeep Chaudhary's convoy in Haryana's Panchkula on Friday evening. A man, identified as Goldy, who was part of Chaudhary's convoy, sustained two bullet injuries during the attack.

Rohit Sharma shocked as Virat Kohli fails to use DRS after LBW dismissalIndia vs Bangladesh: Captain Rohit Sharma was shocked after Virat Kohli decided to not take DRS after being given out LBW in the second innings of the Chennai Test. The replays showed that Kohli had inside edged the ball.

050507497 does not exist: When Israeli mobile bomb killed The Engineer in 1996Yahya Ayyash, popular as 'The Engineer', was Hamas's chief bombmaker whose devices had killed around 150 people. Spy agency Shin Beit used a cellphone bomb to kill Israel's most-wanted terrorist in 1996, when most of the world hadn't even seen a mobile. His killing in Gaza City came three decades before Hezbollah pager blasts in Lebanon.

Collegium not a search panel: Supreme Court pulls up Centre on judges' selectionAs per convention, the government is obliged to accept the collegium's recommendation for appointment of judges if the decision has been reiterated.

Viral at Paris Olympics, Korean shooter Kim Yeji lands acting role as assassin South Korean Kim Yeji landed her first acting role, a month after she went viral at the Paris Olympics for her distinctive style at the range. Kim will work with Indian actor Anushka Sen in a spin-off series of the film 'Asia'

Ashneer Grover's brother-in-law arrested in BharatPe fraud caseThe Delhi Police Economic Offences Wing (EOW) has arrested Deepak Gupta, a relative of BharatPe co-founder Ashneer Grover, in connection with allegations of fund misappropriation.

iPhone 16 buyer gets tired of queues, orders online and receives it in minutesThe iPhone 16 series sale is now live on both online and offline stores. The enthusiasts have been standing outside the store since last night, hoping to be the first ones to get their hands on the new gen iPhones. However, one customer was done with the queues and could not wait any longer. Here is what he did.

Memes take over social media as Blinkit, BigBasket deliver iPhone 16 in minutesAs quick commerce platforms such as Blinkit, Zepto, and BigBasket delivered iPhones within minutes to customers, hilarious memes and jokes flooded social media.

Planning to upgrade to iPhone 16? Here is how much cashback Apple will give for your old iPhoneApple offers significant cashback for trading in old iPhones when upgrading to the iPhone 16 series, which is now available for purchase in India. The trade-in value varies depending on the model and condition of the old iPhone.

Laddoo samples found to be 'pathetic', highly adulterated: Tirupati temple official Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams (TTD) Executive Officer stated that five lab tests confirmed the use of lard (pig fat) and poor-quality ghee in laddoos distributed to the devotees of Lord Venkateswara shrine.

How Trump vs Harris in US elections could affect ties with IndiaWhile some have suggested that the result of the elections will have minimal to no effect on the bilateral ties between the US and India, there are sectors that could witness a changing dynamic, depending on who wins the race.
Video: Drunk rehab manager assaults addicts seeking help at Surat centerAllegations suggest the manager has a history of assaulting those seeking treatment while under the influence of alcohol.

Rajinikanth loses cool ahead of Vettaiyan event: Don't ask political questionsSuperstar Rajinikanth arrived in Chennai hours before the grand audio launch of his upcoming film, Vettaiyan. He lashed out at a reporter who asked him a political question about Udhayanidhi Stalin.

Changed ghee brand behind 'animal fat in Tirupati laddoo' controversy?Chandrababu Naidu's claim, citing a lab report, that animal fat was found in the ghee procured during the YSR Congress Party regime has brought into focus the halt in the supply of the famous Nandini ghee last year.

Stormrider: Jacqueline Fernandez brings out her boldest self in debut singleJacqueline Fernandez released her debut single, Stormrider. The actor showcased a vibrant persona and explored themes of empowerment and resilience.

Alia Bhatt sends heartfelt birthday wish to 'pops' Mahesh Bhatt: No one like youFilmmaker Mahesh Bhatt turned 76 today, September 20. On the special occasion, his daughter and wife wished him on social media with throwback photos and a sweet note.

Malayalam actor Kaviyoor Ponnamma dies at 79, Prithviraj pays tributeVeteran Malayalam actor Kaviyoor Ponnamma has died in Kochi, Kerala, after a long battle with cancer. She was 79. Actor-director Prithviraj has paid tribute to her via social media.

Top 10 Bollywood movies of 2024 and their Box OfficeThe year 2024 saw many surprise Bollywood hits at the box office. While Stree 2 remained on top, the Hindi versions of many South Indian biggies also performed well. Check the list of top 10 Bollywood movies of 2024 at the box office.

sports.headline: Pakistan in race against time to upgrade facilities for Champions Trophy 2025Champions Trophy 2025: Pakistan are hoping to complete the renovations of the three host venues by January 31. An ICC delegation recently visited the venues to take stock of the upgrades.

Jasprit Bumrah on kids copying his action: 'I don't recommend it'India vs Bangladesh: India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah reacted to many youngsters copying his action. Speaking to Jio Cinema, Bumrah said that he does not recommend his unconventional action to kids.
Hardik Pandya likely to play red-ball cricket for Baroda Indian all-rounder Hardik Pandya has his eyes on returning to red-ball cricket after last playing first-class cricket way back in 2018.

Karachi loses PAK vs ENG Test due to Champions Trophy renovationPAK vs ENG: The PCB has moved the second Test between Pakistan and England out of Karachi. Multan will host the Test match.

Virat Kohli's best action moments from 2024Virat Kohli was part of some incredible moments in 2024 as he had a fantastic IPL and T20 World Cup this year. Kohli played a starring role in both tournaments.

Tamim Iqbal hails Rohit Sharma, Jadeja's masterstroke on Day 2 of Chennai TestIND vs BAN: Former Bangladesh batter Tamim Iqbal hailed Rohit Sharma and Ravindra Jadeja's planning masterclass on Day 2 of the Chennai Test. Tamim said the Indian duo planned the wicket of Litton Das brilliantly.

Not going to accept mediocrity: Ricky Ponting's mantra for PBKS revivalRicky Ponting has said that he will not be accepting mediocrity at PBKS after becoming the new coach of the franchise. Ponting took over as the PBKS coach after leaving DC at the end of 2024 season.

Jasprit Bumrah becomes 6th Indian pacer to take 400 international wickets India vs Bangladesh: Jasprit Bumrah became only the 10th Indian bowler to take 400 wickets in international cricket. The fast bowler achieved the feat after taking 3 wickets in the first two sessions on Day 2 of the Chennai Test.

Yuzvendra Chahal signs off for Northamptonshire with 19 county wicketsYuzvendra Chahal ended his county championship stint with another 5-wicket haul as Northamptonshire secured a dominant nine-wicket victory over Leicestershire.

Watch: Rishabh Pant apologises to Mohammad Siraj after DRS error leaves him lividIndia wicketkeeper batter Rishabh Pant apologised to Mohammed Siraj on Day 2 of the second Test against Bangladesh after his DRS error denied him a wicket.

Vikram Rathour reunites with coach Rahul Dravid at Rajasthan Royals IPL 2025: Rajasthan Royals appointed Vikram Rathour as their batting coach for the upcoming season. The former India opener will reunite with Rahul Dravid, who was named as the head coach of the IPL franchise in September.

Champions League: Barcelona boss Hansi Flick sees positives despite Monaco lossBarcelona boss Hansi Flick said that he can see positives from his side's performance despite their loss to AS Monaco in the Champions League on Thursday, September 19. Barca lost 2-1 after Eric Garcia got a red card.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
